intro: Tovaria fusca, commonly known as the black-eyed Susan, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a dark brown center. Tovaria fusca is often found in open woodlands and prairies, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking native, drought-tolerant plants.
